com.facebook.buck.cli

Class BuckConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.facebook.buck.cli.BuckConfig

  • @Beta
@Immutable
public class BuckConfig
extends java.lang.Object
    Structured representation of data read from a .buckconfig file.

    • Method Detail

      • createFromFiles

        public static BuckConfig createFromFiles(ProjectFilesystem projectFilesystem,
                         java.lang.Iterable<java.io.File> files,
                         Platform platform,
                         ImmutableMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> environment)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Takes a sequence of .buckconfig files and loads them, in order, to create a BuckConfig object. Each successive file that is loaded has the ability to override definitions from a previous file.
        Parameters:
        projectFilesystem - project for which the BuckConfig is being created.
        files - The sequence of .buckconfig files to load.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getIgnorePaths

        public ImmutableSet<java.nio.file.Path> getIgnorePaths()
        A set of paths to subtrees that do not contain source files, build files or files that could affect either (buck-out, .idea, .buckd, buck-cache, .git, etc.). May return absolute paths as well as relative paths.

      • getBasePathToAliasMap

        public ImmutableMap<java.nio.file.Path,java.lang.String> getBasePathToAliasMap()
        Create a map of BuildTarget base paths to aliases. Note that there may be more than one alias to a base path, so the first one listed in the .buckconfig will be chosen.

      • createAnsi

        public Ansi createAnsi(Optional<java.lang.String> defaultColor)
        Create an Ansi object appropriate for the current output. First respect the user's preferences, if set. Next, respect any default provided by the caller. (This is used by buckd to tell the daemon about the client's terminal.) Finally, allow the Ansi class to autodetect whether the current output is a tty.
        Parameters:
        defaultColor - Default value provided by the caller (e.g. the client of buckd)

      • getAaptOverride

        public Optional<java.nio.file.Path> getAaptOverride()
        Returns the path to the platform specific aapt executable that is overridden by the current project. If not specified, the Android platform aapt will be used.
